job_description: Data Analyst, Early College and Career Education - job post Chicago Public Schools 1,766 reviews Chicago, IL 60602 $56,000 - $71,000 a year -  Part-time, Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $56,000 - $71,000 a year Job Type Part-time Temporary Data Analyst, Early College and Career Education Job Number: 220001AD Posting Date : Feb 15, 2023, 9:30:49 AM Primary Location : Central-42 West Madison Street (Early College and Career) CPS Non-Union Job Grade : S06 JOB DESCRIPTION - Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third-largest school district in the United States, serving over 330,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning. Located in the Office of College and Career Success (OCCS), the Department of Early College and Career Education (ECCE) provides CPS students with opportunities to take career and college courses while in high school, saving them time and money while pursuing their post-secondary education. The Data Analyst will contribute to a diverse array of projects that support the goal of creating access to college and career instruction, advising, and ultimately enrollment in a postsecondary pathway for all CPS students. This position will design and implement data collection and reporting systems to continuously enhance the quality and breadth of data-informed decisions and communications. Additionally, the Data Analyst will conduct analyses in order to inform day-to-day practice, drive strategy and policy, and to monitor key program and student outcomes. The Data Analyst will also serve as the internal lead on accessing key CPS data systems and will be responsible for managing on-demand data requests to answer key questions about the initiatives and operations of ECCE. This position will report to the Manager of Business Operations in ECCE. The Data Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities: Serve as the system administrator for the Work-Based Learning team’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) System Develop processes to strategically and systematically collect, archive, and report work-based learning data in an accurate and timely manner, using automated processes where possible. Implement key processes of the annual summer internship program Analyze and visualize data on a project basis to enhance understanding of and usage by key stakeholders. Prepare and disseminate analysis reports, briefs, and presentations; communicate results meaningfully to various audiences both internal and external. Engage in capacity building with internal staff around using data to inform practice and strategy. Analyze CPS and 3rd party student-level data, handle data requests and special analyses, support grant proposals and funder reporting, and provide data and reports to external research partners. Assist in determining key future analyses and metrics based on findings from internal and external research, literature reviews, and collaboration with external partners. Lead or participate in workgroups with internal staff and external partners to support strategic planning, continuous improvement, and the development of new initiatives. Ensure data quality and integrity across Offices Adhere to a set of guiding principles for analytic practice as established by the Data Governance Council Work with approved enterprise analytic tool sets. (SAS, SQL) Compile, manipulate, and analyze data using appropriate statistical techniques Participate in District’s Data Analyst User Group Perform related duties as required In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Data Analyst must possess the following qualifications: Education Required : A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university is required; Focus in education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or a related field requiring quantitative coursework, is preferred. Master’s degree preferred Experience Required : A minimum of two (2) years of professional experience in a relevant field and a role requiring data analysis skills is required One or more years of experience as a business analyst or systems analyst preferred Experience managing and/or engaging with CRM systems required Familiarity with Taleo, PeopleSoft, or similar systems preferred Experience writing code with data analytic tools (SAS, R, SPSS, STATA, etc) Experience drafting ad hoc surveys, programming content into online survey platforms (Alchemer, Survey Monkey, Qualtrics, etc.), and presenting findings to stakeholders Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities : Ability to use or learn SAS required Advanced experience with Excel and gSuite applications Exceptional organizational, communication (oral and written), and problem-solving skills Strong attention to detail and data quality assurance Ability to deliver high-quality results in a fast-paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies and meet established deadlines Able to lead independently under general guidance and as part of a team Capable of coordinating efforts and collaborating with a variety of individuals having conflicting agendas Ability to establish priorities and manage multiple activities while meeting established deadlines Ability to work in a cross-functional team with technical and non-technical personnel from a variety of departments Flexibility to meet changing departmental needs and priorities Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously Adheres to a high level of professionalism at all times across professional interactions (ie- meets deadlines, is responsive to communications and requests, etc.) Conditions of Employment As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to: Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. This Chicago residency requirement does not apply to part-time/temporary positions. Be Fully Vaccinated or Submit to Weekly COVID-19 Testing - Employees are required to be fully vaccinated within 30 days of their hire date. Full vaccination is defined as at least two weeks after your second shot of a two-shot vaccination course, or at least two weeks after a one-shot vaccination course. Unvaccinated staff must submit to weekly testing. CPS Non-Union Job Grade: S06 Estimated Annual Salary Range: $56,000 - $71,000 Final salary offers are dependent upon candidate qualifications.

Data Science Support Analyst - Part-time/Temporary Role - job post Chicago Public Schools 1,766 reviews Chicago, IL 60602 Part-time, Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Temporary Data Science Support Analyst - Part-time/Temporary Role Job Number: 230000E0 Posting Date : Mar 14, 2023, 2:11:02 PM Primary Location : Central-42 West Madison Street (Information & Technology Svcs) 35.00 Position Type : Non-Union Position Overtime Status : Non-exempt Final salary offers are dependent upon candidate qualifications. JOB DESCRIPTION - Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is one of the largest school districts in the United States, serving over 330,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning. The Office of Information and Technology Services (ITS) works to build the capacity of schools to use information and technology, maintain network infrastructure, security standards, and support other departments to meet district goals. ITS provides innovative technology solutions that improve the quality of education for students, reduce the administrative burden on educators, facilitate parent interaction, increase community engagement, and support CPS’ mission of transparency by focusing on the ease and equity of access to information. Job Summary: The focus of the Data Science Support Analyst, IT is to use data to drive progress towards District priority and goals. The analyst will accomplish this by providing sound data, analytical, survey, and project management expertise to Offices within the district and helping set district standards for data processes and toolsets for analytics This part-time/temporary position will be compensated for time worked on an hourly basis. The work schedule for this role will consist of an estimated 20 - 30 hours per week for an anticipated period of 4 months beginning 4/17/2023 and ending 8/31/2023. Due to the part-time/temporary nature of this work, this is not a benefit-eligible position. This role will report to the Data Science and Insights Team Lead. The part-time/temporary Data Science Support Analyst, IT will be held accountable for the following responsibilities: Support analytic project planning, design and implementation across a variety of topic areas Support other team members by fulfilling data requests, preparing data files, providing feedback on code, and collaborating on project methodology Compile, manipulate, and analyze data using appropriate statistical techniques to make recommendations and provide strategic planning for long term projects Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of business strategies using approved enterprise analytic toolsets (SAS or SQL) Collaborate with internal stakeholders at varying levels to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions Adhere to a set of guiding principles for analytic practice as established by the Data Governance Council Performs related duties as required In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Data Science Support Analyst, IT must possess the following qualifications: Education Required: A bachelor’s degree in education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or a related field including quantitative coursework A master’s degree in education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or a related field including quantitative coursework is preferred Experience Required: Minimum of three (3) years of professional experience in a role requiring data analysis and reporting skills Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Experience writing code with data analytic tools (SAS, R, Python, SPSS, Stata, etc.) and the ability to use or learn SAS required Proficiency in Relational Databases (SQL Server 2012 preferred) Experience drafting ad hoc surveys, programming content into online survey platforms (Alchemer, SurveyMonkey, Qualtrics, etc.), and presenting findings to stakeholders Exceptional organizational, communication (oral and written), and problem-solving skills Strong attention to detail and data quality assurance Ability to deliver in a fast-paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies and meet established deadlines Ability to work in a team, with technical and non-technical personnel, and across departmental boundaries Flexibility to meet changing departmental needs Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously Conditions of Employment As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to: Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. The Chicago residency requirement does not apply to temporary/part-time positions, however, all CPS employees must be residents of Illinois. Be Fully Vaccinated Against COVID-19 - Unless approved for a medical or religious exemption, all employees are required to be up-to-date on COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters, and to submit proof of vaccination to the district within 30 days of hire. “Up-to-date” on vaccination is defined as being at least two weeks past all primary vaccine doses and any applicable boosters.
